messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Daddy faux pas was:Satellite (directv)
messages.messageBody:
<<Phil spent the nite at his brothers house once and yelled from the
shower, "Hey Robert, grab my panties out of my bag please!!!" >>

Before our boys were born, we had Christopher and five girls in the house.
He was severely outnumbered! He often called his underwear his 'panties'
just from hearing us say it so much and I tend to call his unders panties
too, just makes life easier I guess.

When Ethan came along he couldn't wait for him to start wearing underwear so
he wouldn't have to call them panties anymore, on purpose or by accident.
Ethan just turned three and we also now have Caeleb who is 2 but neither are
out of diapers yet. Funny thing is, Ethan and Caeleb both call them
panties!! Poor Chris is fighting a losing battle!

Jennifer

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Daddy faux pas was:Satellite (directv)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/16/03 7:48:24 PM Pacific Daylight Time, jmcseals@msn.com ... LMAO  Phil spent the nite at his brothers house once and yelled from the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/16/03 7:48:24 PM Pacific Daylight Time, jmcseals@...
writes:

> Totally off topic but a good run-off....
>
> He told me that in the middle of working on a job once, he turned to the guy
>
> he was working with and told him he'd be right back, he had to 'go potty'!
> LOL!
>
> Jennifer
>

LMAO Phil spent the nite at his brothers house once and yelled from the
shower, "Hey Robert, grab my panties out of my bag please!!!" He said he waited
for a good five minutes and then walked out in his towel to find his brother and
their 2 cousins holding their bellies with laughter. Phil asked what they
were laughing about and why the hell didn't Rob bring him his drawers? Robert
fell back onto his bed and held up Phil's underwear and said, "Don't you mean
your panties?"

Rhonda - who's poor hubby lives in a house full of panties
